accepted. Message from VirtualCarolyn: Welcome! I'm VirtualCarolyn. I'm here to have an interactive dialogue with you to assist you in your programming task. INTRO_SHORT. Starting blockout countdown...
ACCEPTED! Message from VirtualCarolyn: What type of android app are you planning to develop? TUTOR
ACCEPTED! Message from VirtualCarolyn: Great, I'll help you create a plan for an audio recorder. TUTOR
ACCEPTED! Message from VirtualCarolyn: Should we get started? TUTOR
ACCEPTED! Message from VirtualCarolyn: Spend some time coming up with your initial plan. Press "I'm ready" button when you think you are done. Let me know if you have any questions! TUTOR

ACCEPTED! Message from VirtualCarolyn: We need to set an output format type on recorder object. TUTOR
ACCEPTED! Message from VirtualCarolyn: It seems you have a question regarding output format. TUTOR

mRecorder.setOutputFormat(MediaRecorder.OutputFormat.MPEG_4);|Ok, move on. TUTOR
starting 10 second delay timer for DEMO_TUTORIAL
ACCEPTED! Message from VirtualCarolyn: Yes, we need to set an audio encoder for the recorder object. TUTOR

ACCEPTED! Message from VirtualCarolyn: It seems you have a question regarding recorder instance. TUTOR
ACCEPTED! Message from VirtualCarolyn: I can help you decide on the type of recorder api to use and give you an example code snippet.|Have you decided on a recorder api to use? TUTOR

ACCEPTED! Message from VirtualCarolyn: Ok|Maybe this will help:|You can record audio using the MediaRecorder or AudioRecord APIs if supported by the device hardware|Which one would you like to choose? TUTOR

ACCEPTED! Message from VirtualCarolyn: If you use MediaRecorder, it will record compressed audio into a file.
If you use AudioRecord, you must read and compress the audio from the internal buffer separately.
MediaRecorder can record only the following file types: AAC_ADTS, AMR_NB, AMR_WB, MPEG_4, RAW_AMR, THREE_GPP, WEBM|Which api will you use? TUTOR
